channel.title: Object's Text Entry too small in Gnome
channel.description: Hi, I'm using Axoloti Patcher on Linux (debian and ubuntu-based distros) with gnome-shell 3.28.3 and I have a problem with any object with a text entry such as wave/play or string/c. Basically, the text entries are all too small to actually view what text is being entered. They function normally but it is impossible to read text that's entered as it is squished down or cut off to like two or three pixels tall. I took a look at the 'edit object definition' to see if I could change to size manually but I have found no obvious way to do it. Does anyone have any ideas? Is it perhaps a bug that needs to be fixed? I don't have a problem editing the code myself but before I start tearing everything apart to make my own solution I'd appreciate if anyone could point me in the right direction first. Thank you in advance, -Andrew
